senses.sense_definition: An occupation or profession, especially one that involves special training and is followed as one's lifework.

examples.text: She decided to pursue a <w>career</w> in medicine after graduating from college.
He ruined his political <w>career</w> by making a controversial statement.

senses.sense_definition: The period of time that someone spends achieving something or performing a specific activity.

examples.text: During his school <w>career</w>, he won several prizes for mathematics.
This was the most difficult match of her entire professional <w>career</w>.

senses.sense_definition: Speed or a course of rapid motion.

examples.text: The horse ran in full <w>career</w> across the open field.
We could not stop the vehicle in its fierce <w>career</w> down the hill.

senses.sense_definition: To move rapidly straight ahead, especially in an uncontrolled or dangerous way.

examples.text: The truck <w>careered</w> off the road and crashed into a fence.
We watched the wagon <w>careering</w> down the hill without a driver.

senses.sense_definition: Engaged in a particular activity or profession as a long-term occupation or lifestyle.

examples.text: The police finally caught the <w>career</w> criminal who had robbed ten banks.
As a <w>career</w> diplomat, she has lived in many different countries.
